about_me.title: About me
content: Hello! My name is José Olórtegui, a {{age}} y/o self-taught frontend developer living in Paraguay. With a little over {{yearsOfExperience}} years of experience I specialize myself in frontend web technologies and I like to take care of the user experience and bring to the table quality in the things I build.
In my spare time, most of the times, you will find me playing games or build something that I probably need to improve my everyday workflow.

positions.title: Senior Frontend Developer
tasks: Maintain primarily a Web App and a Mobile App. Worked a lot with React, React Native and Material UI.
Built an API that outputs well designed and localized email templates. Built with Next.js, MJML and MDX.
Kickstart the migration to Typescript and React Query.
Dockerize a huge Spring Boot/PostgreSQL application for better frontend ergonomics.
Migrated the whole Web App frontend from Create React App to Vite.

positions.title: Freelance
tasks: Worked on a lot of projects with Wordpress and its ecosystem.
Develop a Mobile App for one of the largest social clubs in my country. Built with Angular and Ionic.
Learned a lot about RxJS and reactive programming.

positions.title: Girolabs S.A — Technical Coordinator
tasks: Help to solve issues with implementations that didn't allow the team to make progress.
Research and implement new technologies, methodologies or tools into the team's workflow.

positions.title: Girolabs S.A — Project Manager
tasks: Manage the timings of the projects for all of our clients.
In charge of managing the relationship between the client and the team.

positions.title: Girolabs S.A — Visual & Frontend Developer, UI Designer
tasks: Developed a lot of custom themes for Wordpress from scratch.
I was in charge of producing mostly all of the development work for our clients.
Also in charge of the UI/UX design for all of the projects.

skills_stack.title: Skills & Stack
content: Expert with Typescript, Angular and Ionic. Also with Wordpress.
Currently deep diving into React and React Native.
For styling I like to use Tailwind CSS, but I can switch to any CSS library or even plain CSS.
Used before other metaframeworks such as Next.js and Astro.
Web scrapping with Puppeteer. Would love to try Playwright in a real project.
Comfortable with the terminal and Linux.
Had to learn the lua programming language since I use Neovim as my code editor.
Learning a lot about bundlers with Vite.
Comfortable using design software such as Figma and Photoshop.
I use Notion and Todoist to organize myself.

open_source.title: Open Source
description: I've got interested in the tooling that surround us developers so, I started contributing to open source projects this year in a more consistent basis.
